dependencies.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others
dependencies.name: binutils

dependencies.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.
dependencies.name: llvm

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
A generalist algorithm for cell and nucleus segmentation that can be
optimized for your own data
dependent_to.name: cellpose

dependent_to.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM
dependent_to.name: py-numba

dependent_to.description:
Many useful operators, however, do not lend themselves to an explicit
matrix representation when used to solve large-scale problems. PyLops
operators, on the other hand, still represent a matrix and can be
treated in a similar way, but do not rely on the explicit creation of a
dense (or sparse) matrix itself. Conversely, the forward and adjoint
operators are represented by small pieces of codes that mimic the effect
of the matrix on a vector or another matrix.
dependent_to.name: py-pylops

dependent_to.description:
PyNNDescent is a Python nearest neighbor descent for approximate nearest
neighbors.
dependent_to.name: py-pynndescent

description: A lightweight LLVM python binding for writing JIT compilers
name: py-llvmlite

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
